page.title: 11Milcroft Tea Gardens
page.content: Milcroft tea gardens was built as a farm around 1700. At the turn of this century it was made into a market garden and planted with both fruit and ornamental trees. The monkey-puzzle trees date from this time. The market garden was not a great success so a shed was added to the side of the house and the opened as a tea garden. "Our busiest time is when it is sunny. We get about 100 people. In bad weather we might get less than 6." There are old plaques on the wall, one of Queen Victoria from 1880 and another from the fire in Rochdale Town Hall in 1880. The plant pots outside the gardens show eight types of flowers and trees in the area. The gardens are also used to stage various sorts of entertainment.
